    VALUE - is the generic type of the value.
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().

    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUiWidgetComboboxField, AbstractUiWidgetListBoxField, AbstractUiWidgetRadioButtonsField, AbstractUiWidgetRadioButtonsVerticalField, UiWidgetRadioButtonsTestImpl, UiWidgetRadioButtonsVerticalFieldTestImpl

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetOptionsField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterOptionsField<VALUE>,VALUE>
extends AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER,VALUE,String>
implements UiWidgetOptionsField<VALUE>, AttributeWriteAllowCustomInput
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiWidgetOptionsField.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • doGetValue

        protected VALUE doGetValue(VALUE template,
                           ValidationState state)
                    throws RuntimeException
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValue(). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. The following cases have to be distinguished:
        • For native fields this method has to get the actual value from the underlying native widget (text-box, password-field, etc.).
        • For custom fields this method will be responsible to convert from the delegates value (see UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()) to the proper value type. E.g. if you want to create a custom widget to edit your own datatype such as CustomerNumber based on a UiWidgetTextField you need to convert from String to CustomerNumber.
        • For custom composite widgets you should use AbstractUiWidget.getDataBinding(). UiDataBinding.createAndBind(net.sf.mmm.util.pojo.path.api.TypedProperty) that gives you high-level support and makes your live easy. Then there is no need to override this method.
        • For other cases, especially if <VALUE> is Void, there is nothing to do here.
        The implementation of this method has to correspond with the implementation of AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean) .
        Overrides:
        doGetValue in class AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterOptionsField<VALUE>,VALUE,String>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May only be null if according to data-binding (e.g. if <VALUE> is an (immutable) Datatype).
        state - is the ValidationState. May be null (if the validation is omitted). Should only be used to propagate to AbstractUiWidget.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState) of children.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If <VALUE> is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) the template is NOT null and is to be returned by this method after the value(s) of this widget have been assigned. For immutable datatypes template will be null and this method has to create a new instance of <VALUE> based on the end-users input in the widget.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean)

      • convertFromValue

        protected String convertFromValue(VALUE widgetValue)
        This method converts the given widgetValue to the type used by the widget adapter. The default implementation simply performs a cast. You have to override this method if <VALUE> and <WIDGET_VALUE> differ.
        Overrides:
        convertFromValue in class AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterOptionsField<VALUE>,VALUE,String>
        Parameters:
        widgetValue - is the value to convert. Will NOT be null (See AbstractUiWidgetField.getNullValue()).
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • convertToValue

        protected VALUE convertToValue(String adapterValue,
                               ValidationState state)
        This method converts the given adapterValue from the widget adapter to the type of this value. The default implementation simply performs a cast. You have to override this method if <VALUE> and <WIDGET_VALUE> differ.
        Overrides:
        convertToValue in class AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterOptionsField<VALUE>,VALUE,String>
        Parameters:
        adapterValue - is the value to convert. Will NOT be null.
        state - is the ValidationState or null if not called without validation.
        Returns:
        the converted value.

      • getNullValue

        protected String getNullValue()
        This method gets the result of AbstractUiWidgetField.convertFromValue(Object) for the value null. It is called for null values instead of AbstractUiWidgetField.convertFromValue(Object) to prevent NullPointerExceptions. The default is null - override to change.
        Overrides:
        getNullValue in class AbstractUiWidgetField<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterOptionsField<VALUE>,VALUE,String>
        Returns:
        the value representation of null for the widget adapter.

      • getOptions

        public List<VALUE> getOptions()
        This method gets the options of this object. The options are the available values to choose a selection from. The List shall not contain duplicate entries. It may contain the value null.

        the Formatter.

      • isAllowCustomInput

        public boolean isAllowCustomInput()
        This method determines if custom input is allowed by this object (widget). This is typically used in combination with options, that predefine values the user can select from. Some widgets like a combo box allow the user to enter any text. If this method returns false the entered text is only valid if it matches one of the predefined options. The default is false. You may change this by setting this flat to true. Please note that depending on the datatype this might not make sense. E.g. if you are using an Enum as value and the user enters arbitrary text this can not be converted to a non existent enum constant and therefore will only return null without causing a validation failure.
        Specified by:
        isAllowCustomInput in interface AttributeReadAllowCustomInput
        Returns:
        true if custom input is allowed and accepted, false otherwise.

      • setAllowCustomInput

        public void setAllowCustomInput(boolean allowCustomInput)
        This method sets the allowCustomInput flag.
        Specified by:
        setAllowCustomInput in interface AttributeWriteAllowCustomInput
        Parameters:
        allowCustomInput - is the new value of AttributeReadAllowCustomInput.isAllowCustomInput().
